duty: observe animals for signs of illness, injury, or unusual behavior, notifying veterinarians or managers as warranted
title: First-Line Supervisors

duty: observe fish and beds or ponds to detect diseases, monitor fish growth, determine quality of fish, or determine completeness of harvesting
title: First-Line Supervisors

duty: perform both supervisory and management functions, such as accounting, marketing, and personnel work

duty: plan work schedules according to personnel and equipment availability

duty: read inventory records, customer orders, or shipping schedules to determine required activities

duty: requisition or purchase supplies, such as insecticides, machine parts or lubricants, or tools

duty: schedule work crews, equipment, or transportation for several different work locations

duty: train workers in spawning, rearing, cultivating, and harvesting methods, and in the use of equipment

duty: train workers in techniques such as planting, harvesting, weeding, or insect identification and in the use of safety measures

title: First-Line Supervisors

title: First-Line Supervisors

duty: treat animal illnesses or injuries, following experience or instructions of veterinarians
title: First-Line Supervisors

duty: check all load-related documentation for completeness and accuracy

duty: check conditions of trailers after contents have been unloaded to ensure that there has been no damage

duty: crank trailer landing gear up or down to safely secure vehicles
title: Heavy and Tractor-Trailer Truck Drivers

duty: drive trucks to weigh stations before and after loading and along routes in compliance with state regulations

duty: drive trucks with capacities greater than 13 tons, including tractor-trailer combinations, to transport and deliver products, livestock, or other materials
